title: What are some ways to take the power generated from a triboelectric nanogenerator and transmit it to a battery or something that requires power? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s very very difficult. Triboelectricity is high voltage, low current, and batteries are the opposite. And any generator the uses friction is going to be a very low efficiency device. I doubt if the scheme would ever pay for itself, even if it ran 100 years.

If you are trying to convert mechanical movement into usable power for batteries, piezo would be a better choice. Lower volt, higher current. You would just need a capacitor to allow voltage to build and to maintain consistent output.
